thing-type.label: ZEN23 Toggle Switch v3
thing-type.description: Toggle Switch v3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFEATURES</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtManual or remote on/off control from your mobile device or computer (when included to a Z-Wave gateway controller) </li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Plus with improved 500 chip for faster and safer wireless communication</li&gt <li&gtWorks with LED, CFL, and incandescent bulbs (minimum 15Watts on load required) </li&gt <li&gtBased on simple and universal binary switch command class - supported by most Z-Wave controllers </li&gt <li&gtMay be associated and grouped with other Z-Wave devices for advanced home automation </li&gt <li&gtBuilt-in Z-Wave signal repeater for a stronger and more reliable network </li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtBring your Z-Wave gateway hub or controller within direct range of the switch</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in inclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtToggle the switch up quickly 3 times to finalize the inclusion process</li&gt <li&gtA new on/off device should appear on your controller's device list</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtBring your Z-Wave gateway hub or controller within direct range of the switch</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in exclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtToggle the switch down quickly 3 times to complete the exclusion process</li&gt <li&gtThe device should disappear from your controller's device list</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtPlease repeat the process following all steps carefully if the first attempt is unsuccessful</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Toggle Control
parameter.description: Determines whether up is on and down is off; or up is off, down is on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtToggle Control</p&gt <p&gtParameter 1: Choose if you want the to turn the light on by clicking the toggle up or down<br /&gtValues:<br /&gt0 – Toggle up turns the light on, toggle down turns the light off (default);<br /&gt1 – Toggle up turns the light off, toggle down turns the light on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Auto Turn-Off Timer
parameter.description: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt0 – timer disabled (default)<br /&gt1 – timer enabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_4
parameter.label: 4: Auto Turn-Off Timer Time
parameter.description: Time after which the switch automatically turns off<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse this parameter to set the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt1 – 65535 (minutes). <br /&gt60 – default.<br /&gt<br /&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Auto Turn-On Timer
parameter.description: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt0 – timer disabled (default)<br /&gt1 – timer enabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_4
parameter.label: 6: Auto Turn-On Timer Time
parameter.description: Set the time after which the switch automatically turns on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse this parameter to set the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt1 – 65535 (minutes). Default set to 60</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameter.description: Set the on off status for the switch after power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter 8: Set the on off status for the switch after power failure.</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt0 – forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage);<br /&gt1 – forced to ON (regardless of state prior to power outage);<br /&gt2 – remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Enable/Disable Scene Control
parameter.description: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick 2-tap.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable scene control functionality for quick 2-tap.</p&gt <p&gtValues:</p&gt <p&gt0 – scene control disabled (default).<br /&gt1 – scene control enabled.</p&gt</p&gt
